description: Learn how to build Single Page Applications using React Router: Nested routes, Layouts, and Dynamic params.

slides.title: React Router DOM
slides.content:
# SPA Routing ğŸš

React is a Single Page Application (SPA).

To simulate navigation (changing URL without reloading page), we use libraries like `react-router-dom`.

Installation:
`npm install react-router-dom`

slides.title: Basic Setup
slides.content:
# The Router ğŸ”Œ

Wrap your entire app in `<BrowserRouter>`.

Define routes using `<Routes>` and `<Route>`.

```jsx
<BrowserRouter>
  <Routes>
    <Route path="/" element={<Home />} />
    <Route path="/about" element={<About />} />
  </Routes>
</BrowserRouter>
```

slides.title: Navigation
slides.content: # Link vs Anchor ğŸ”— Do NOT use `` tags. Use `` component. ```jsx // Bad (Causes refresh) About // Good (SPA navigation) About ```

slides.title: Nested Routes
slides.content:
# Nested Layouts ğŸª†

Great for dashboards where the sidebar stays but content changes.

```jsx
<Route path="dashboard" element={<DashboardLayout />}>
  <Route path="stats" element={<Stats />} />
  <Route path="settings" element={<Settings />} />
</Route>
```
Inside `DashboardLayout`, use `<Outlet />` to render the child route.

slides.title: Programmatic Navigation
404 Page
slides.content:
# Not Found Route ğŸš«

Handle unknown URLs by adding a catch-all route at the end.

```jsx
<Route path="*" element={<NotFound />} />
```
The `*` matches any path that hasn't been matched yet.

slides.title: Lazy Loading
slides.content: # Code Splitting ğŸ’¤ Don't load the entire app at once. Load pages as needed. ```jsx const About = React.lazy(() => import('./About')); // Wrap in Suspense Loading...}> ```

slides.title: Code Example
Summary
slides.content:
# Recap: Routing ğŸ“

SPA Navigation.

- **Setup:** `<BrowserRouter>` and `<Routes>`.
- **Links:** `<Link>` prevents refresh.
- **Params:** `useParams` for `/user/:id`.
- **Nested:** `<Outlet>` for layouts.
- **Navigation:** `useNavigate` hook.
